name: transparent-tribe

procedures: T1027::[Transparent Tribe] has dropped encoded executables on compromised hosts.
T1036.005::[Transparent Tribe] can mimic legitimate Windows directories by using the same icons and names.
T1059.005::[Transparent Tribe] has crafted VBS-based malicious documents.
T1189::[Transparent Tribe] has used websites with malicious hyperlinks and iframes to infect targeted victims with [Crimson], [njRAT], and other malicious tools.
T1203::[Transparent Tribe] has crafted malicious files to exploit CVE-2012-0158 and CVE-2010-3333 for execution.
T1204.001::[Transparent Tribe] has directed users to open URLs hosting malicious content.
T1204.002::[Transparent Tribe] has used weaponized documents in e-mail to compromise targeted systems.
T1564.001::[Transparent Tribe] can hide legitimate directories and replace them with malicious copies of the same name.
T1566.001::[Transparent Tribe] has sent spearphishing e-mails with attachments to deliver malicious payloads.
T1566.002::[Transparent Tribe] has embedded links to malicious downloads in e-mails.
T1568::[Transparent Tribe] has used dynamic DNS services to set up C2.
T1583.001::[Transparent Tribe] has registered domains to mimic file sharing, government, defense, and research websites for use in targeted campaigns.
T1584.001::[Transparent Tribe] has compromised domains for use in targeted malicious campaigns.
T1608.004::[Transparent Tribe] has set up websites with malicious hyperlinks and iframes to infect targeted victims with [Crimson], [njRAT], and other malicious tools.

description: [Transparent Tribe](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0134) is a suspected Pakistan-based threat group that has been active since at least 2013, primarily targeting diplomatic, defense, and research organizations in India and Afghanistan.(Citation: Proofpoint Operation Transparent Tribe March 2016)(Citation: Kaspersky Transparent Tribe August 2020)(Citation: Talos Transparent Tribe May 2021)
